game

Enum HouseRules

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<HouseRules>
      • game.HouseRules
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<HouseRules>

    public enum HouseRules
extends java.lang.Enum<HouseRules>
    A list of the types of house rules that may be applied to CAH.
    Contents:
  • HAPPY_ENDING
  • REBOOTING_THE_UNIVERSE
  • PACKING_HEAT
  • RANDO_CARDRISSIAN
  • GOD_IS_DEAD
  • SURVIVAL_OF_THE_FITTEST
  • SERIOUS_BUSINESS
  • NEVER_HAVE_I_EVER
      IDEA: some of these rules where the cards are ranked by players might be good for teaching the computer because it would give it more info.
Since:
CAH1.0
Version:
CAH1.0
Author:
Holt Maki

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      GOD_IS_DEAD
      "Play without a Card Czar.
      HAPPY_ENDING
      "When you're ready to stop playing, play the "Make a Haiku" Black Card to end the game.
      NEVER_HAVE_I_EVER
      "At any time players may discard cards that they don't understand, but they must confess their ignorance to the group and suffer the resulting humilliation." NOTE: May be good for teaching the computer.
      PACKING_HEAT
      "For Pick 2s (and pick 3, draw 2s), all players draw an extra card before playing the hand to open up more options."
      RANDO_CARDRISSIAN
      "Every round, pick one random White Card from the pile and place it into play.
      REBOOTING_THE_UNIVERSE
      "At any time players may trade in an Awesome Point to return as many White Cards as they'd like to the deck and draw back up to ten."
      SERIOUS_BUSINESS
      "Instead of picking a favorite card each round, the card Czar ranks the top three in order.
      SURVIVAL_OF_THE_FITTEST
      "Play without a Card Czar.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • HAPPY_ENDING

        public static final HouseRules HAPPY_ENDING
        "When you're ready to stop playing, play the "Make a Haiku" Black Card to end the game. This is the official ceremonial ending of a good game of Cards Against Humanity, and this card should be reserved for the end. (NOTE: Haikus don't need to follow the 5-7-5 form. They just have to be read dramatically)."
        Since:
        CAH1.0

      • REBOOTING_THE_UNIVERSE

        public static final HouseRules REBOOTING_THE_UNIVERSE
        "At any time players may trade in an Awesome Point to return as many White Cards as they'd like to the deck and draw back up to ten."
        Since:
        CAH1.0

      • PACKING_HEAT

        public static final HouseRules PACKING_HEAT
        "For Pick 2s (and pick 3, draw 2s), all players draw an extra card before playing the hand to open up more options."
        Since:
        CAH1.0

      • RANDO_CARDRISSIAN

        public static final HouseRules RANDO_CARDRISSIAN
        "Every round, pick one random White Card from the pile and place it into play. This card belongs to an Imaginary player named Rando Cardrissian and if he wins the game, all players go home in a state of everlasting shame."
        Since:
        CAH1.0

      • GOD_IS_DEAD

        public static final HouseRules GOD_IS_DEAD
        "Play without a Card Czar. Each player picks his or her favorite card each round. The card with the most votes wins the round."
          NOTE: Make the computer have a very slight bias like everyone else will, so that it is not completely at a disadvantage.
        Compatability Issues: SURVIVAL_OF_THE_FITTEST, SERIOUS_BUSINESS
        Since:
        CAH1.0

      • SURVIVAL_OF_THE_FITTEST

        public static final HouseRules SURVIVAL_OF_THE_FITTEST
        "Play without a Card Czar. After everyone has answered the question, players take turns eliminating one card each. The last remaining card is declared the funniest."
          NOTE: Make the computer have a very slight bias like everyone else will, so that it is not completely at a disadvantage.
        Compatability Issues: SERIOUS_BUSINESS, GOD_IS_DEAD
        Since:
        CAH1.0

      • SERIOUS_BUSINESS

        public static final HouseRules SERIOUS_BUSINESS
        "Instead of picking a favorite card each round, the card Czar ranks the top three in order. The best card gets 3 Awesome Points, the second-best gets 2, and the third gets 1. Keep a running tally of the score, and at the end of the game, the winner is declared the funniest, mathematically speaking."
        Compatability Issues: SURVIVAL_OF_THE_FITTEST, GOD_IS_DEAD
        Since:
        CAH1.0

      • NEVER_HAVE_I_EVER

        public static final HouseRules NEVER_HAVE_I_EVER
        "At any time players may discard cards that they don't understand, but they must confess their ignorance to the group and suffer the resulting humilliation."
          NOTE: May be good for teaching the computer. If the computer doesn't understand a card, it can discard it so that it may learn about it.
        Since:
        CAH1.0
